definition: anonymous (e.g. author, donor etc)
not to have/no/none/not/to lack/un-/-less
name/noun (part of speech)/place (e.g. among winners)/famous/classifier for people
clan name/maiden name
see 月氏[Yue4 zhi1] and 閼氏|阏氏[yan1 zhi1]

sentences.english: You know who Mr. X is?
This song was written by an anonymous author.
sentences.chinese: 這道歌是一位無名氏寫的。

sentences.english: Or, as an anon put it while discussing targets yesterday
sentences.chinese: 或者，就像一名無名氏在昨天討論目標時所說的那樣。

definition: short comment or critical appraisal added at the end of a text, on a painting etc
appendix

notes on poetry, an essay genre consisting of informal commentary on poems and poets and their lives (old)/a genre of narrative literature interspersing prose with poetry, popular in the Tang and Song dynasties
Nalan Xingde (1655-1685), Manchu ethnic Qing dynasty poet
Ma Zhiyuan (c. 1250-1321), Yuan dynasty dramatist in the 雜劇|杂剧[za2 ju4] tradition of musical comedy, one of the Four Great Yuan Dramatists 元曲四大家[Yuan2 qu3 Si4 Da4 jia1]
variant of 匯編|汇编[hui4 bian1]
Zhang Dai (1597-c. 1684), late Ming scholar
Huang Zunxian (1848-1905), Qing dynasty poet and diplomat, author of A Record of Japan 日本國誌|日本国志[Ri4 ben3 Guo2 zhi4], an extended analysis of Meiji Japan
Su Zhe (1039-1112), Northern Song writer and calligrapher, one of the 三蘇|三苏[San1 Su1] and also one of the 唐宋八大家[Tang2 Song4 ba1 da4 jia1]
surviving manuscript/bequeathed draft (of book)
Huang Zongxi (1610-1695), scholar and writer of the Ming-Qing transition
Ji Yun (1724-1805), Qing Dynasty writer, author of supernatural novel Notes on a Minutely Observed Thatched Hut 閱微草堂筆記|阅微草堂笔记
notes/key (to exercises)
to include (in a collection)/to put together (stories, poems etc)/to record/to employ/to recruit
